title: Man threw dog out of window after breaking into woman’s home
text:
Caption: A man threw a pet dog 30 feet out of a window

Media Wales

A man is facing a possible jail sentence after he broke into a woman’s home before throwing her dog out of the second storey window.

Daniel Williams, 30, messaged Jordanna Davies to say he was outside her home in Cilfrew, Neath, but she replied saying she was not home.

A short time later a neighbour called to say they had seen Williams smash a window to get into her home and threw Dobbie the Jack Russell/chihuahua cross, four, out of the window.

She rushed home and found Dobbie covered in blood with injuries to his legs and hip.

As a single mum on benefits, she was unable to pay for the bills by herself and was told unless she handed over more than £2,000 the dog would be put down.

Dobbie survived the fall but needs a lot further operations that Jordanna can not afford (Picture: Media Wales)

Daniel Williams messaged to say he was outside her home but when she said she wasn’t there he broke in and threw Dobbie out (Picture: Media Wales)

She managed to raise the funds with donations from other people, but Dobbie still requires another £3,000 hip operation and Jordanna has set up a gofundme page.

Jordanna said: ‘It caused me great stress and anxiety. I don’t feel safe living there anymore after knowing he was able to smash the window and get in.

‘I was settled before the incident took place. I had to live with my window boarded up for a while.

‘Dobbie is a small, defenceless pup who would not hurt anyone.

‘I absolutely broke my heart. I turned up in a taxi when I heard what had happened and I could see Dobbie with blood coming from his mouth. I could not hold or move him.

Dobbie was almost put down following incident, but his owner managed to raise funds for an operation (Picture: Media Wales)

‘I could not believe someone would do that to an animal. I could not understand it. I didn’t expect to see it at all.

‘He is a lovely family pet, I had rescued him from an abusive home. He has always been quite a nervous dog anyway.

‘The last month has been awful. It’s been really hard. When it first happened I slept on the floor next to him for a week.’

Williams, a carpenter, had initially denied any wrongdoing but changed his plea ahead of a trial. He will be sentenced next month.

Dobbie still needs an operation that is expected to cost in the region of £3,000

Miss Davies added that, as a single mother in receipt of benefits, she’d had to rely on the help of others to fund the bills to help Dobbie.

‘A family member donated £1,000,’ she said.

‘I have been doing little things like cupcake stalls with all the funds going towards Dobbie. We’ve also set up a fundraising page which is growing slowly.’
